title: Judge Ends Deportation Case for Mexican Father of 3 U.S. Marines
summary: The arrest of Narciso Barranco, who was detained by federal agents while landscaping outside an IHOP in Southern California last June, garnered national attention.

title: Senators Press Officials on Agents’ Approach to Protesters
Leqaa Kordia, Columbia Protester in ICE Custody for Nearly a Year, Suffers Seizure
summary: Leqaa Kordia, 33, of New Jersey, was hospitalized after hitting her head at a Texas detention center, her lawyer said. She was initially arrested during a 2024 protest at Columbia University.

title: Border Officials Are Said to Have Caused El Paso Closure by Firing Anti-Drone Laser
summary: People familiar with the episode said the use of the technology was not coordinated with the Federal Aviation Administration. Officials targeted what they thought was a drug cartel drone, but turned out to be a party balloon, they said.

title: What We Know About the El Paso Airspace Shutdown
summary: The Trump administration blamed the disruptive halt on a cartel drone incursion, but others have disputed that explanation.

title: Europe Worries Trump Poses Threat to Its Financial and Tech Sovereignty
summary: European leaders have been compelled to address the possibility of once-remote risks to the financial networks and technology that undergird their economies.

title: Americans Are Paying the Bill for Tariffs, Despite Trump’s Claims
summary: Research from the New York Fed confirms that U.S. companies and consumers are bearing tariff costs, despite the president’s assertions otherwise.

title: Judge Temporarily Blocks Hegseth From Punishing Mark Kelly Over ‘Illegal Orders’ Video
summary: Judge Richard J. Leon found that attempts to discipline Mark Kelly for a video that warned against following illegal orders would violate the senator’s First Amendment rights.

title: Senate Questions Health Care Firm for Profiting Off Program Meant for Poor
summary: The program was meant to help hospitals provide for poor patients by offering drug savings. But critics say a Texas company has turned it into a big business, driving up costs for patients and insurers.

title: Ukrainian Olympian Is Disqualified Over Helmet Honoring War Dead
summary: Olympic officials ruled that Vladyslav Heraskevych’s helmet violated a prohibition on political speech, setting off outrage at the Winter Games in Italy.

title: To Stay in Her Home, She Let In an A.I. Robot
summary: At 85, Jan Worrell lived alone on a remote corner of the Washington coast. Could ElliQ become her companion?

title: Why Pennsylvania’s Two Most Powerful Democrats Don’t Speak
summary: Senator John Fetterman and Gov. Josh Shapiro do not get along. The bad blood goes back years.

title: Crypto Super PAC Targets Al Green, a Texas Democrat Who Voiced Concerns
summary: A crypto-backed super PAC plans to spend $1.5 million against Mr. Green, a member of the House Financial Services Committee who has expressed concerns about cryptocurrency.

title: Anthropic Donates $20 Million to Super PAC Operation to Counter OpenAI
summary: Anthropic and OpenAI now have their own well-funded political groups that will square off in the midterm elections over artificial intelligence safety and regulation.

title: Maybe America Needs Some New Cities
summary: It sounds a bit kooky to promise a whole city from scratch. But it has been done before — and might just help solve the housing crisis.

title: Lawmakers Question Bondi Over Justice Dept. Under Her Watch
summary: Her appearance came as the Justice Department was under scrutiny over the Epstein files, its approach toward the shootings in Minneapolis and its move to prosecute six lawmakers.

title: Epstein Files Include Grainy Videos From Inside His Florida Home
summary: The clips from Jeffrey Epstein’s home office appear to show him with young women.

title: Henry McGowan Found Not Guilty By Reason of Insanity in Father’s Murder
summary: Henry McGowan of New York City was charged in the death of his father in an Irish hotel. He had struggled with mental illness for several years.

title: Turkish Nobel Novelist Orhan Pamuk Gets the Netflix Series He Wanted
summary: After publishing more than 20 books and winning a Nobel Prize, the Turkish author fought to bring a celebrated novel to the screen — on his own terms.

title: What We Know About the Victims of the Tumbler Ridge Mass Shooting in Canada
summary: The attack at a secondary school and a private residence in the small, remote community in British Columbia has left families stunned and grief-stricken.

title: Mamdani Says Little About NYCHA as He Targets Bad Landlords
summary: Mayor Zohran Mamdani has pledged to hold private landlords accountable. But he has said less about how he will fix the crumbling public housing system he now oversees.

title: Mamdani Reverses Campaign Promise to Expand Rental Assistance
summary: A rental voucher program costs more than $1 billion. The mayor’s decision to curtail its expansion reflects the clash between his ideology and the realities of managing the city.

title: Satellite Pictures Show Snow And Ice Across North America
summary: For much of North America, the last month has been an icy, frozen trudge. But from the right vantage point, it had a certain beauty.

title: Youngstown, Ohio, Has Been Freezing Because of a Broken Utility
summary: An insolvent, broken utility left downtown buildings in Youngstown freezing in recent weeks. Gov. Mike DeWine has attributed the problems to an archaic system.

title: The Snow Sure Was Beautiful. Now Here Comes the River of Yuck.
summary: Melting mega-piles of grimy road snow can release weeks worth of salt, oils (and dog poop) in what one scientist called a “triple whammy.”

title: Alcohol’s Effects on the Body: What Does Drinking Do to Your Health?
summary: From the moment you take a sip, drinking starts to influence your biology. Here’s an inside look.

title: ‘Wuthering Heights’ Review: Margot Robbie, Amok on the Moors
summary: The actor and Jacob Elordi play the tortured lovers from the Emily Brontë classic in this florid, overstuffed version by Emerald Fennell.

title: Mass Detention Gets a Lift From the Courts
summary: A very dangerous ruling in New Orleans.

title: Trump and the Death of Shared Morality in America
summary: In this installment of The Conversation, David Brooks says goodbye to The Times, and offers his parting thoughts.

title: Building Cities from Scratch
summary: We explore one possibility for relieving the U.S. housing crisis.

title: Laid-Off Battery Plant Workers Pin Blame on Ford, not Trump, for Lost Jobs
summary: Ford Motor shut down a battery factory and laid off 1,600 workers after President Trump and Republicans gutted government support for electric vehicles.

title: Bans on Many CBD Products Loom This Year
summary: A federal law taking effect in November severely limits the amount of THC, the euphoric cannabis compound, allowed in over-the-counter items. Many groups are fighting back.

title: N.Y.C. Officials Condemn Stonewall Pride Flag Removal Ahead of Rally
summary: Activists and officials plan to re-raise the flag on Thursday, setting up a defiant response to the Trump administration’s assault on diversity initiatives.
